newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ Labour finalising coalition document-spokesman.
newsitem.headline: NZ Labour finalising coalition document-spokesman.

text.p: New Zealand's Labour Party was on Wednesday finalising a definitive coalition proposal document to pass to the nationalist New Zealand First Party, a Labour spokesman said.

He said "The Document" was being drafted on Wednesday morning to be passed to NZ First for its consideration, after which a meeting between Labour and NZ First negotiators would probably be scheduled.
NZ First is also in coalition talks with the caretaker National Party government.
The Labour spokesman could not confirm whether the document had already been handed over to NZ First.
Caretaker Prime Minister Jim Bolger declined comment on the state of coalition negotiations as he entered a meeting of National's parliamentary caucus.

National and Labour have both been negotiating to form a government with NZ First since an inconclusive general election on October 12. Parliament is due to convene for the first time by December 13. -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 473-4746
